org.nzdis.micro.bootloader

Class MicroBootProperties

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.nzdis.micro.constants.PlatformConstants
      • org.nzdis.micro.bootloader.MicroBootProperties

  • public class MicroBootProperties
extends PlatformConstants
    MicroBootProperties allows the override of configuration-file defined settings in-code if called before platform initialization.
    Version:
    $Revision: 1.1 $ $Date: 2013/02/28 00:00:00 $
    Author:
    Christopher Frantz

        public static MicroPropertiesMap bootProperties

      • MicroBootProperties

    • Method Detail

      • load

        public static void load()
        Helper method to enforce execution of static block (i.e. reading of configuration file) without invoking any 'meaningful' method.

      • platformInitialized

        public static void platformInitialized()
        Marks the platform as started. Further changes to the configuration will not be taken into account for platform.

      • isPlatformInitialized

        public static boolean isPlatformInitialized()
        Indicates if platform is initialized
        Returns:
        boolean Value indicating if platform is already initialized

      • setExecutorProperties

        public static void setExecutorProperties(java.lang.Integer numberOfCoreSchedulers,
                                         java.lang.Integer numberOfCoreExecutors)
        sets various capabilities for MICRO_FIBER message passing framework, namely number of schedulers for message dispatch and number of worker threads for message processing.
        Parameters:
        numberOfCoreSchedulers - Number of schedulers to be used
        numberOfCoreExecutors - Number of executors to be used for message delivery

      • activateNetworkSupport

        public static void activateNetworkSupport(boolean distributedMode)
        Activates network support for platform. All network-related functionality depends on this setting (network transport, network discovery, heartbeat).
        Parameters:
        distributedMode - Boolean indicator if platform should be started in distributed mode

      • setNetworkTcpPort

        public static void setNetworkTcpPort(java.lang.Integer port)
        Sets the TCP port for network communication.
        Parameters:
        port - Port to be bound for TCP communication

      • setDynamicTcpPortSelection

        public static void setDynamicTcpPortSelection(boolean selectDynamic)
        Indicate if system should dynamically use other ports if the specified one is occupied

      • setMicroMessageValidator

        public static void setMicroMessageValidator(java.lang.String messageValidator)
        Sets message validator used for application. Please ensure to activate MicroMessage.globalValidation or any other validation-related switch in order to use this functionality.
        Parameters:
        messageValidator - Fully qualified class name of message validator (implementing the MicroMessageValidator interface)

      • startHeartbeat

        public static void startHeartbeat(boolean activateHeartbeat,
                                  int frequencyInSeconds,
                                  int heartbeatTimeoutFactor)
        Configures heartbeat with according parameter set.
        Parameters:
        activateHeartbeat - Boolean indicator for activation
        frequencyInSeconds - Frequency between heartbeat messages
        heartbeatTimeoutFactor - Timeout factor which will be multiplied with frequency to determine timeout

      • activateNetworkDiscovery

        public static void activateNetworkDiscovery(boolean activateDiscovery,
                                            boolean startDiscovery)
        Configures the discovery service.
        Parameters:
        activateDiscovery - Activates service
        startDiscovery - Starts discovery (else only passive)

      • setNetworkDiscoveryMode

        public static void setNetworkDiscoveryMode(java.lang.String discoveryMode)
        Configures the Network discovery mode (BROADCAST or MULTICAST) (see constants in @DiscoveryModes).
        Parameters:
        discoveryMode - Discovery mode to be used

      • setMulticastGroup

        public static void setMulticastGroup(java.lang.String multicastAddress,
                                     java.lang.Integer port)
        Configures Multicast group for discovery service (if Multicast is chosen for network discovery)
        Parameters:
        multicastAddress - Multicast group address
        port - Port to bind

      • setBroadcastPort

        public static void setBroadcastPort(java.lang.Integer port)
        Sets the broadcast port on which discovery service will be listening (if broadcast discovery mode is chosen).
        Parameters:
        port - Broadcast port to bind

      • setNetworkSerialization

        public static void setNetworkSerialization(java.lang.String serialization)
        Sets the network serialization for the network communication (see @SerializationTypes).
        Parameters:
        serialization - Serialization type to use

      • startLazy

        public static void startLazy(boolean lazy)
        Indicates if platform components should be started lazy. Default: true
        Parameters:
        lazy - true --> lazy, false --> explicit start using startPlatform().

      • setInternalMessageTransport

        public static void setInternalMessageTransport(java.lang.String framework)
        Sets the internal message transport system (JETLANG or MICRO_FIBER) (see @MessagePassingFrameworks). Defaults to JETLANG. Note: Use MICRO_FIBER for large number of agents for better scalability (e.g. 100+ agents).
        Parameters:
        framework - Framework to use for message transport

      • setSynchronousMessageDeliveryMode

        public static void setSynchronousMessageDeliveryMode(boolean synchronousMode)
        Sets synchronous (i.e. blocking) delivery mode for local message passing. Default: false. Note, that this requires the implementation of the handleMessage() method for @SocialRole implementations to prevent messages from being stored in a message queue (asynchronous mode). The system will do this check at runtime.
        Parameters:
        synchronousMode - Specifies if synchronous message delivery is chosen

      • activateClojureSupport

        public static void activateClojureSupport(boolean activated)
        Activates the Clojure support for the platform. If activated allows the use of Clojure for role implementations.
        Parameters:
        activated - Indicates if Clojure support should be activated

      • setPlatformOutputLevel

        public static void setPlatformOutputLevel(int outputLevel)
        Sets the console output level of platform messages. Values: 0 --> no application-level platform output - only initialization configuration output and errors 1 --> Additionally to 0, provide output on agent creation/disposal. 2 --> Additionally to 1, output warnings.
        Parameters:
        outputLevel - Level of output as indicated above

      • setTimePrefixForPlatformOutput

        public static void setTimePrefixForPlatformOutput(boolean activate,
                                                  boolean dateOutput,
                                                  boolean nanoTimeOutput)
        Activates time prefix for platform output, optionally including date. Alternatively to conventional time display, nanotime can be displayed.
        Parameters:
        activate - Activates time prefix (if false, no prefix will be printed independent of other parameters)
        dateOutput - Prints date along with time
        nanoTimeOutput - Prints nanotime output instead of conventional calendar time format

      • setAgentConsoleOutputLevel

        public static void setAgentConsoleOutputLevel(int outputLevel)
        Sets the console output level for individual agents/roles. This allows a fast switch to boost performance. Values: 0 --> no agent output (neither print() nor printError()) 1 --> only error output (printError()) 2 --> all output produced by agent (print() and printError())
        Parameters:
        outputLevel - Level of output as indicated above

      • setPrefixForMultiLineAgentConsoleOutput

        public static void setPrefixForMultiLineAgentConsoleOutput(boolean prefixForMultiLineOutput)
        Indicates if each line of multiline output of agents on console should be prefixed with agent name. Default: false
        Parameters:
        prefixForMultiLineOutput - Switch indicating if each line is prefixed with agent name or only first one (false)

      • setMessageTypePrefixForAgentConsoleOutput

        public static void setMessageTypePrefixForAgentConsoleOutput(boolean printMessageTypePrefix)
        Indicates if message type (e.g. 'INFO' or 'ERROR') should be printed explicitly in agent console output to allow easier filtering by message type during analysis. Default: false
        Parameters:
        printMessageTypePrefix - Switch indicating if message type is printed

      • setNanoTimePrefixForAgentConsoleOutput

        public static void setNanoTimePrefixForAgentConsoleOutput(boolean setTimePrefix)
        Indicates if agent console output should be prefixed with time in nanoseconds. Default: false
        Parameters:
        setTimePrefix - Boolean indicating if nanotime should be printed

      • setRandomNumberGeneratorSeed

        public static void setRandomNumberGeneratorSeed(long seed)
        Sets the seed for the pseudo random number generator (RNG). Can be changed at runtime (not advisable!).
        Parameters:
        seed - Seed to be used for platform RNG

      • setPlatformName

        public static void setPlatformName(java.lang.String name)
        Sets the platform name.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the platform

      • readConfiguration

        public static void readConfiguration()
                              throws java.lang.Exception
        Reads the platform configuration from configuration file 'platform.xml' in user directory (usually project root path).
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Exception thrown if operation system could not be detected
